default: Soft moss cushions the Glade, the runic portal tree towering above still whispering with latent sparks.
The Glade breathes in quiet rhythm—portal tree, mossy ground, and the distant susurrus of the stream.
Echo coils near the HT radio on a sun-warmed stone; the snake's antenna-like tendrils glint with static.

portal_tree.name: portal tree
descriptions: The portal tree's bark is etched with dormant runes; faint warmth pulses beneath your fingertips.
Close up, the portal tree's runes shimmer like embers, promising a way home once awakened.

campfire_ring.name: campfire ring
descriptions: Charred stones and neat ash hint at recent nights spent trading stories with allies.
The campfire ring sits ready—only kindling and a spark stand between you and warmth.

glade_stream.name: stream
descriptions: Clear water threads past the Glade, cold enough to jolt tired thoughts awake.
The stream gurgles softly, carrying the forest's scents deeper south.

echo.name: Echo
descriptions: Echo's scales shimmer with faint radio static as they watch you with patient, lidless eyes.
Echo rests coiled around the HT radio, tongue tasting the air with soft bursts of static.

default: Branches loom overhead, and the trail twists through a crowd of ancient trunks.

edge: At the forest's edge, trail markers are still visible and the Glade's breeze brushes your shoulders.
mid: Mid-forest shadows stretch long; runes carved into trunks glow faintly as you pass.
deep: In the deep forest, roots jut like ribs and every sound seems swallowed by the loam.

trail_markers.name: trail markers
descriptions: Notches hacked into bark chart your path; some are yours, others older.
Trail markers glow faintly with resin—proof others have braved this route.

ferns.name: ferns
descriptions: Damp ferns brush your knees, hiding beetles and the occasional startled hare.
The ferns are slick with dew, concealing the narrow trail unless you watch your footing.

runic_stump.name: runic stump
descriptions: Runes carved into the stump glow when your hand hovers close—someone left warnings here.
The runic stump's sigils pulse in rhythm with your heartbeat before fading again.

default: Blackened heartwood bows overhead, ember veins tracing the hollow that swallowed you whole. A fallen branch partially blocks the opening, but you can see daylight beyond.

Ash-moted light filters through rune-burned fractures, painting the interior in copper ghosts. Faint runes and sigils are burned into the charred bark—marks that weren't here before. The only exit is a cramped opening partially blocked by a fallen branch.

portal_scars.name: portal scars
descriptions: Each rune scar still hums with fading portal energy, edges shimmering violet beneath the soot.
You trace a rune scar—warm to the touch, as though time itself only just stitched it closed.

camp_pack.name: camp pack
descriptions: Your camp pack sits half-spilled, dusted with ash yet mercifully intact.
Canvas creaks as you lift the pack; everything smells of smoke, but the straps hold.

charred_floor.name: charred floor
descriptions: The floor is a mosaic of soot and splintered charcoal, footprints marking your arrival.
Ash shifts underfoot, hiding coal-hot embers that glow when your weight passes.

splintered_opening.name: splintered opening
descriptions: A fallen tree branch partially blocks the opening, but you can squeeze past it into the Glade beyond.
The opening is cramped, a fallen branch wedged across it. You'll need to crawl past to reach the Glade.

fallen_branch.name: fallen branch
descriptions: A thick branch has fallen across the opening, partially blocking your way out. It's not a gate or door—just an obstruction you can squeeze past.
The fallen branch is charred like the rest of the tree, but it's loose. You can crawl under or around it to exit.

default: A modest mountainside cabin. Bookshelves line the walls, and a small window looks out over a misty valley. Someone is sitting at a laptop on a wooden desk.

laptop.name: laptop
descriptions: The laptop screen shows code—Lost Hiker source files. A half-finished cup of coffee sits next to the keyboard.
Lines of Python code scroll across the screen. You recognize some of the function names from your own journey.

bookshelves.name: bookshelves
descriptions: Books on game design and coding line the shelves. Some titles you recognize, others are unfamiliar.
The books range from technical manuals to design theory. A well-worn copy of 'The Art of Game Design' sits prominently.

window.name: window
descriptions: The window looks out over a misty valley. The view seems to shift slightly, as if reality itself is uncertain here.
Beyond the glass, mountains fade into mist. You're not entirely sure this place exists in the same world you came from.
